bioghist.p: Englishton Park Presbyterian Ministries (EPPM) Incorporated is a non-profit organization, founded by the Presbyterian Church in 1952 to serve the needs of the community. Originally the summer home of several generations of the English family dating back to the mid-1800's, Englishton Park is now a multi-use campus serving the community and the needs of children by providing them academic remediation and education. EPPM is located on more than 300 acres in Lexington, Indiana, approximately thirty miles north and east of Louisville, Kentucky. Englishton Park, the large ancestral estate of William E. English was acquired by the National Missions Committee of the Synod of Indiana in 1958. It was used by the Committee for ministries with children and elderly persons. Programs included the Roe-Seal Memorial Retirement Home, an Academic Remediation Program, a Boys' Club Camp, a foster home, and workcamps and service projects.

scopecontent.p: This collection mostly consists of photocopies which are comprised of legal documents related to the sale of a portion of the estate's land; articles of incorporation, amended 1982; minutes of the Synod Assembly relating to Englishton Park and the Presbyterian National Missions Homes, Inc.; and a 1966 report of the President of Presbyterian National Missions Homes, Inc. There are also brochures for Englishton Park.
